intro: Hibbertia papillata, commonly known as the rough-hairy sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with a distinctive central disk. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Hibbertia papillata typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in various regions of southern Australia. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance.
